thinking.disposable_income: Greater Greenspoint has a relatively low median household income around $35,000, with many residents living below the poverty line and facing significant financial constraints.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have limited discretionary spending capacity, with a high proportion of income going to essential needs like housing and transportation.
thinking.accessibility: The area has moderate transit access with bus services but high car dependency, with about 75% of residents commuting by car and facing significant transportation costs relative to their income.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized lower transit fares ($0.75) to make public transit more affordable for low-income residents. 2) Favored lower sales tax rates (0.5-1.0%) to minimize impact on essential purchases. 3) Considered moderate driving fees ($0.50) to encourage transit use while not overly burdening car-dependent residents. 4) Balanced travel time improvements with cost impacts. 5) Selected proposals that provide the best combination of affordability and service improvements for this lower-income community.
